title: Support configuring SyslogHandler max message length
body:
### Describe the bug

We have extended Keycloak to forward ATNA-compliant audit events to a rsyslog service using quarkus bundled with the keycloak release. 

The bundled quarkus release does not support configuring the max message length for the underlying syslog handler from jboss. 

Section [6.1 of RFC-5424](https://datatracker.ietf.org/doc/html/rfc5424#section-6.1) suggests that 2048 may be a sensible default, but there is no upper limit. Note the behaviour of the underlying [org.jboss.logmanager.handlers.SyslogHandler](https://github.com/jboss-logging/jboss-logmanager/blob/b846cd7869e1575769983f8009207ec1c7cb8306/src/main/java/org/jboss/logmanager/handlers/SyslogHandler.java#L486) aligns with the RFC on this point. 

### Expected behavior

We would expect quarkus to use a sensible default, as per section [6.1 of the RFC-5452 spec](https://datatracker.ietf.org/doc/html/rfc5424#section-6.1) (e.g. 2048 octets) and to support configuring this value as per the requirements of a consuming product. 

### Actual behavior

Quarkus does not expose the ability to configure the max length via the underlying [org.jboss.logmanager.handlers.SyslogHandlers#setMaxLength](https://github.com/jboss-logging/jboss-logmanager/blob/b846cd7869e1575769983f8009207ec1c7cb8306/src/main/java/org/jboss/logmanager/handlers/SyslogHandler.java#L789) method. 

Any message sent to the handler larger than the default as derived from the type (e.g. 2048 see [here](https://github.com/jboss-logging/jboss-logmanager/blob/b232ab0f783ed6582448e5b49622d680a7556f70/src/main/java/org/jboss/logmanager/handlers/SyslogHandler.java#L486)) is truncated and needs reconstructing on the receiving end.
